intro: Ceraia ventripes, commonly known as the brown-lipped sea snail, is a species of sea snail in the family Eulimidae. It is a small, marine gastropod mollusk that typically inhabits shallow coastal waters. The shell is conical, with a smooth surface and a distinctive brown lip. The animal has a slender, elongated body with a well-developed radula for feeding on algae and other microscopic organisms. Its ecological role includes contributing to the biodiversity of marine ecosystems and serving as prey for various marine predators.
